strings: <se_low>Yangus: I ain't got a clue meself, but I wonder wot it's like bein' engaged from the day yer born?

<se_def>Angelo: Ah, you're thinking about Princess Medea?
Well, personally, I'd love to have a fiancée.

<se_def>Angelo: With a safety net like that, you could try your hand at the game of love to your heart's content and never worry.<page>Angelo: You'd always have someone to fall back on.
Who could want for more!?
<se_high>Jessica: You know, you don't exactly sound like someone who's spent most of his life in an abbey.
<se_low>Yangus: Oh yeah, the old codger said somefin' about 'ow the 'orse-princess is engaged to someone from 'ere, eh?
<se_high>Jessica: I think this is where Lorenzo's from.

<se_high>Jessica: Do you remember Lorenzo?
The man who thought he was my fiancé?

<se_high>Jessica: You do?
Even though you only met him once or twice?
You've got quite a memory, <hero>!
<se_high>Jessica: Lorenzo's the son of the Chancellor here.

<se_high>Jessica: That's why my mother chose him to be my future husband.
WITHOUT consulting me, I might add.<page>Jessica: Can you believe it!?
She's obsessed with smuggling me into polite society, whether I like it or not.

<se_high>Jessica: You barely spoke to him.
It's no wonder you don't remember him.
<se_high>Jessica: Lorenzo's the son of the Chancellor here.

<se_high>Jessica: That's why my mother chose him to be my future husband.
WITHOUT consulting me, I might add.<page>Jessica: Can you believe it!?
She's obsessed with smuggling me into polite society, whether I like it or not.
<se_def>Angelo: If Dhoulmagus came here with the intention of another murder, I suppose his target would probably be a member of the royal family.
<se_def>Angelo: But maybe it's not even possible to predict that. Who knows if there's any rhyme or reason to what he's doing?
<se_low>Yangus: It would be a lot quicker if the old codger just asked the King 'ere for a loan o' that magic mirror, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: If I was green, I think I'd make more of an effort, but Grandad's no use to no one!
<se_high>Jessica: I've been thinking, too. Why don't we just tell the King of Argonia the truth? Ask him outright for permission to borrow the magic mirror?
<se_high>Jessica: We would have to leave out the part about King Trode and Princess Medea, of course.
<se_def>Angelo: I'm not all that keen on royalty and the aristocracy.
<se_def>Angelo: If I had the choice, I'd much rather have nothing to do with them.
<se_low>King Trode: Well! Now you've made yourself perfectly clear, you rotten young rascal!
<se_low>Yangus: COR BLIMEY!

<se_low>King Trode: Of all the insolence!
So this is what you've been thinking of me, is it!?

<se_def>Angelo: Now I've gone and done it.
But I didn't mean him.<page>Angelo: He hardly acts like an average king, after all.
...Or looks like one, for that matter.
<se_def>Angelo: I wonder why Dhoulmagus killed the owner of the casino.
<se_def>Angelo: I can't explain it, but I suspected his next victim would be some kind of royalty.
<se_def>Angelo: But I still don't think there's any rhyme or reason to what he's doing.
<se_low>Yangus: I reckon the Prince is more likely to be in the castle than out an' about on the streets.
<se_high>Jessica: Why don't we just take our charmless little Prince to the King so that we can wash our hands of this errand?
<se_def>Angelo: So Prince Charmles is going to rule this kingdom one day?

<se_def>Angelo: It just isn't right.
I understand that he hates the idea of this initiation, but hiding is not a solution.<page>Angelo: And running away certainly doesn't seem like an ideal preparation for running a kingdom!
<se_high>Jessica: With Prince Charmles at the helm, I could see Argonia becoming something like Pickham.
<se_def>Angelo: Of course, I'm thankful that we have a means of acquiring the magic mirror.
<se_def>Angelo: But it'll be incredibly frustrating if Dhoulmagus disappears from the Dark Ruins while we're stuck here in the middle of a royal drama.
<se_low>Yangus: I wonder if the Prince'll 'ave a fit when 'e sees the old codger.
<se_low>Yangus: I mean, maybe 'e'll get 'im confused wiv a lizard!
<se_low>Yangus: Still, I s'pose 'e looks more like a frog than a lizard, so 'opefully it'll be awright.
<se_high>Jessica: Looks like we have ourselves a new job!
<se_high>Jessica: We'd better hurry up and make our way out of town. After all, we wouldn't want to keep our valiant little Prince waiting.

<se_def>Angelo: Do you think the Prince can fight at all?
I get the feeling he won't be too keen if we run into any monsters on the way.

<se_low>Yangus: It'd be a bit of a blow if 'e went an' got 'imself killed, eh?
We'd be in a right mess if we let that 'appen!

<se_high>Jessica: Watch it, Yangus!
You're going to jinx us, talking like that!

<se_high>Jessica: And what if someone overheard?
They'd think we were trying to kill the Prince!

<se_def>Angelo: What is it with old kingdoms like this?
Why do they insist on hanging onto ridiculous traditions like this initiation?

<se_def>Angelo: Still, at least it isn't anything barbaric, like human sacrifice or something.<page>Angelo: That said, putting the Prince in the ring with anything more dangerous than a common cold seems akin to sacrifice.
<se_low>Yangus: It's a shame Grandad and that Charmless bloke can't see eye to eye.
<se_low>Yangus: I actually feel a bit sorry for the old codger. Bet you never thought you'd see the day!
<se_high>Jessica: I set off on this journey to avenge my brother's death, and yet here I am babysitting this creep!
<se_def>Angelo: Poor Princess Medea. Even if she's freed from this curse, she has to marry that awful Charmless.
<se_high>Jessica: If I were the Princess, I'd rather stay as a horse than marry that guy!
<se_low>Yangus: I've got it! We should find the Princess a nice 'orse-faced bloke wiv goofy teeth an' a long nose! It's the perfect solution!
<se_def>Angelo: How is that perfect!? A horse can't marry a human, you idiot!
<se_def>Angelo: Ah, it's good to get away from Charmless for a while.
<se_def>Angelo: He's always lording it over us! How's a man supposed to relax in these conditions!?
<se_low>Yangus: People are s'posed to come from all over the world to the bazaar, so I bet there'll be a few 'ere from Pickham.
<se_low>Yangus: The only stuff they'll be floggin' is stolen loot, mind, so ya wanna watch out for that.
<se_high>Jessica: I know it must be fun to go to the bazaar, but I really wish the Prince would sort out his priorities and head back to the castle.
<se_def>Angelo: We should have a look around all the bazaar stalls once we've sorted out this business with the magic mirror.
<se_low>Yangus: If the old codger knew 'ow the Prince cheated like that, I doubt 'e'd be best pleased.
<se_def>Angelo: He's hardly over the moon with him at the moment.<page>Angelo: In fact, I doubt he's got any further to fall in Trode's estimations, unless he's actually Dhoulmagus in disguise!
<se_def>Angelo: Surely he'll have to reconsider Princess Medea's marriage now that he realises what kind of person she'd end up with?

<se_high>Jessica: I don't think he can back out of it at this stage.
He has to consider the feelings of his subjects as well as those of King Clavius.

<se_low>Yangus: So it all just comes down to money, eh?
That's bleedin' awful!
Even Pickham's more civ'lised than that!

<se_low>Yangus: I don't reckon we should bring this up wiv King Clavius, anyway. You know 'ow it is.
The messenger's always the one who gets shot, eh?

<se_high>Jessica: I can't believe Charmless!
What a little stinker!
<se_high>Jessica: I never would've bothered going all the way to the royal hunting ground if I'd known he was going to pull that kind of trick.
<se_def>Angelo: Well, at least it's a relief that Charmles didn't order us to shut that trader up, if you know what I mean.

<se_def>Angelo: That'd leave a very unpleasant taste in my mouth.
It's certainly one thing I'd be loath to do, orders or no orders.
<se_low>Yangus: Sometimes you don't 'ave no choice but to tell the odd white lie or two. We'd better just keep schtum 'til we've got the magic mirror.

<se_high>Jessica: Aside from King Clavius, everyone seemed perfectly satisfied by that Argon heart.
They really think the Prince won it himself.

<se_def>Angelo: Don't you think King Clavius was behaving a little strangely at the ceremony?
Maybe he knows something.
<se_def>Angelo: I could just be imagining things, but I can't help feeling that he's found out the truth somehow.
<se_low>Yangus: I almost choked when 'e said to tell 'im the truth!
<se_def>Angelo: Yeah. I was sure he'd refuse to give us the magic mirror if he found out what had really happened.

<se_high>Jessica: Well, Charmles is Clavius's problem now.
We've got bigger fish to fry.
<se_low>Yangus: I dunno 'ow 'e found out, but King Clavius knows all about Charmless's cheatin', eh?
<se_high>Jessica: I know this isn't our fault, but I can't help feeling bad.

<se_high>Jessica: Still, there's no use crying over spilt milk.
Let's get the magic mirror and find Dhoulmagus!
<se_def>Angelo: King Clavius had a very troubled look on his face when he saw the Argon heart before.
<se_def>Angelo: I could hardly stand to look him in the eyes.

<se_low>Yangus: Did ya notice the King earlier, guv?
He did a bit of a double take when 'e looked at you.
<se_high>Jessica: I hope you aren't trying to tell us that the King of Argonia is a friend of yours!?

<se_high>Jessica: Oh, he can't be. I know you too well.
If you really were close to the King, you would've told us a long time ago. Right?
<se_def>Angelo: It looked like the King had you confused with someone else back there for a while, <hero>.

<se_def>Angelo: Why don't you try and brazen it out?
Pretend you're an old friend of his!?
<se_high>Jessica: Stop messing around! Even King Clavius admitted it was a mistake. Remember?
<se_def>Angelo: The King seemed really flustered when he looked at you back then, <hero>...
<se_low>Yangus: I ain't that keen on castles an' abbeys an' the like. Can't seem to relax, y'know.

<se_high>Jessica: I hope the King is a sensible man.
We really need that magic mirror to defeat Dhoulmagus.
<se_def>Angelo: There's no point trying to explain that to him. He'd never listen to us. We'd be better off just stealing the thing and having done with it.

<se_low>Yangus: Oi! That's my line!
Now who sounds like a thief, eh, Angelo!?
<se_high>Jessica: Hey! I thought you were on the straight and narrow!
<se_low>Yangus: Heh heh heh. Yeah, good point.
<se_high>Jessica: I just realised something. I probably never would've had the chance to visit Argonia if I hadn't decided to hunt down Dhoulmagus.

<se_def>Angelo: So here we are.
I'm feeling fairly clueless, I must admit.
<se_def>Angelo: Had any thoughts on how to persuade the King to lend us the magic mirror, <hero>?

<se_def>Angelo: Well, that's good to hear!
It'll be interesting to see how you manage to talk him round!

<se_def>Angelo: Well, that's just great.
I was hoping you might have an idea up your sleeve. Now what!?
<se_low>Yangus: Well, I didn't see that comin', guv!
<se_low>Yangus: Still, if we want that magic mirror, I s'pose we've gotta do wot we've gotta do.

<se_high>Jessica: I had been hoping that the Prince of Argonia would be a real ‘Prince CHARMING’.<page>Jessica: You know, strong but sensitive...gorgeous but modest...riding about on a white horse?
But him? HIM!? Don't even get me started!
<se_low>Yangus: Heh heh! There goes that little fantasy!

<se_high>Jessica: And his name! Even his name annoys me!
How do you pronounce it again?<page>Jessica: He seems to prefer ‘sharm-lay’, like he's some kind of foreign aristocrat. But he's a lot closer to charm-less, if you ask me!

<se_def>Angelo: Ha ha. Steady on!
I hardly think it's his name that's to blame!
<se_high>Jessica: Whatever. In any case, we can't carry out this errand without Prince ‘Sharm-lay’.
<se_high>Jessica: So let's drag his ample behind to the royal hunting ground and get this over with!

<se_def>Angelo: Sometimes I'm so pleased I left the abbey.<page>Angelo: I mean, look at me now, babysitting a prince who can't even wipe his own backside!
Life doesn't get much better than this.
<se_low>Yangus: D'ya reckon the Prince'll really go ahead wiv this 'nitiation? He don't seem all that keen, shuttin' 'imself away in 'is room an' all that.

<se_high>Jessica: Our fates are intertwined with the Prince's...
We can't have the magic mirror unless he passes the initiation.
<se_def>Angelo: Charmless has got quite a shriek on him.

<se_low>Yangus: Yeah, ya can say that again!
Ear-splittin', it was! I'm surprised 'e didn't die o' shock from that racket!

<se_high>Jessica: If he had, it would have been murder!
And the culprit would have been none other than our own little Munchie.

<se_def>Angelo: And no one would ever find out the truth.
Even we don't know what really went on when Munchie was inside that hole.

<se_def>Angelo: I feel sorry for Princess Medea, having to marry such an abject coward.
I mean, who's afraid of lizards!?

<se_low>Yangus: Blimey! Did you 'ear that scream!?
I wonder wot's goin' on?
<se_high>Jessica: Was that shriek...Prince Charmles!?

<se_def>Angelo: Sounds like Munchie had a brainwave when he was inside the hole.
Now that's what I call a shrewd mouse!
<se_low>Yangus: The Prince didn't 'ave much choice about that, eh!?

<se_low>Yangus: An' there I was thinkin' King Clavius was a bit of a softie!
He's actually pretty strict.
<se_high>Jessica: King Clavius gives me the creeps!

<se_high>Jessica: Did you see the way he ogled me!?
And what was that ‘va-va-voom’ thing!?
What a weirdo!
<se_def>Angelo: Even the Prince has finally got an inkling that people in the castle are bad-mouthing him behind his back.
<se_def>Angelo: This could work in our favour. Maybe his injured pride will persuade him not to be such an unbearable nuisance.
<se_low>Yangus: It's good that Charmless got us a free night's kip, eh?
<se_high>Jessica: Let's go and find Prince Charmles. We won't be finished with this little errand until we bring him back to the castle in one piece.
<se_def>Angelo: Well, it certainly didn't take Charmless long to head for the bazaar.

<se_low>Yangus: It'd be a real treat if we could look round the bazaar before goin' after Dhoulmagus.
But I suppose that's no-go, eh?

<se_low>Yangus: Yeah, you're right.
We don't 'ave time for that.
We need to sock it to 'im as soon as we can.

<se_low>Yangus: Sorted! Let's go an' 'ave a look then!
You never know, we might be able to get ourselves a bargain!
<se_high>Jessica: So there's a man in the forest in the west who knows all about the magic mirror.
<se_high>Jessica: Shall we pay him a visit on our way back to the Dark Ruins?
<se_def>Angelo: So Charmless will be King one day... I can't say I particularly care what happens to Argonia, but I doubt it'll be good with him in charge.

<se_high>Jessica: Don't forget about Princess Medea, Angelo.
Won't she have to live in Argonia once she marries the Prince?

<se_def>Angelo: Of course! That slipped my mind somehow.
Well then, I suppose I do care what happens here. The poor Princess...
<se_def>Angelo: I'm worried about what that scholar said. I wonder why he couldn't feel any magic in the mirror...even though it's a magic mirror!?
<se_def>Angelo: Maybe it doesn't have what it takes to break through the aura protecting the Dark Ruins...
<se_low>Yangus: We better get a move on an' take care of any outstandin' business now.
<se_low>Yangus: Cos once we break down the dark aura an' go into them Dark Ruins, we ain't comin' back 'til we've sorted Dhoulmagus.
<se_high>Jessica: Angelo, are you going to leave the Templars when we've defeated Dhoulmagus?
<se_def>Angelo: That's the plan. I don't want to be around my brother any more for one thing.
<se_def>Angelo: And the Abbot was my only real friend at the abbey. Once I've avenged his death, I won't have any more ties with the place.
<se_low>Yangus: Why d'you 'ate your brother so much, eh? You've only got the one, after all. Shouldn't you 'ave a bash at gettin' on?
<se_def>Angelo: It's him who hates me. I don't have any feelings for him at all... None whatsoever.
<se_high>Jessica: Let's hurry up back to the Dark Ruins. Hopefully that mirror we spent so much effort getting hold of will take us to Dhoulmagus at last.
<se_def>Angelo: When we got the magic mirror in Argonia, I thought we were just a breath away from defeating Dhoulmagus.
<se_def>Angelo: But this should be the end of the distractions. Now it's time to finish him off once and for all!
<se_low>Yangus: I'm well pleased that I could take you an' the old codger to Pickham on our travels!
<se_low>Yangus: I don't get why Angelo didn't take to the place. Such a pity! Ha ha ha!
<se_high>Jessica: If Alistair lost to this guy, we should be ready for a tough fight!
<se_high>Jessica: We should make sure we're properly prepared before we go back to the Dark Ruins.
<se_def>Angelo: Jessica's a bit strange when you think about it. She's supposed to be a lady and yet here she is, hunting down her brother's killer!
<se_low>Yangus: She may be a lady by name, but she's from the sticks, ain't she? Just the same as the local yokels at the end o' the day!
<se_low>Yangus: Te he he he hee!
<se_high>Jessica: You've got a cheek talking about me like that! And what's with the weird laugh anyway!?
<se_def>Angelo: I have to avenge the Abbot's death before I can properly draw a line under my life at the abbey.
<se_def>Angelo: When I first set off, I was under orders and nothing more. But now I feel like this is my own duty.
<se_low>Yangus: Maybe she'll just turn up at the inn if we wait long enough, eh?

<se_def>Angelo: I doubt it.
There's something fishy going on here.
<se_low>Yangus: Maybe she just got sick o' travellin' round wiv a bunch of riffy old men...

<se_def>Angelo: OLD!? Speak for yourself!
You're looking at the Goddess's gift to woman[-]kind! Her YOUNG gift to YOUNG womankind!

<se_low>Yangus: This ain't good, eh?
I s'pose all we can do is ask around, an' see if anyone knows where Jessica's got to.

<se_low>Yangus: So much for celebratin' defeatin' Dhoulmagus!
I'd been lookin' forward to that, but now this 'appens!

<se_def>Angelo: I don't understand why Jessica would just go off without saying anything.
Surely she wouldn't be that selfish!?
<se_def>Angelo: I was planning to set off on my travels as soon as we'd defeated Dhoulmagus.
<se_def>Angelo: But I suppose we'd better stick together for a bit longer now, at least until we find her.

<se_low>Yangus: This bazaar goes on for ages, eh?
I can't believe it ain't finished yet!

<se_low>Yangus: I love seein' it all lively like this.
If I 'ad my way, the bazaar'd never end!
<se_high>Jessica: Sealed away inside that sceptre, the Lord of Darkness is plotting the end of the world, and we're the only ones who know about it.

<se_def>Angelo: It can't be helped.
We don't want the whole world to start panicking, right?
<se_low>Yangus: Yeah! An' we'll sort it all out before it gets too bad anyway, so no one'll even 'ave to know about it!
<se_high>Jessica: I don't remember much between leaving Argonia with the sceptre and going through the checkpoint.
<se_def>Angelo: I've avenged the Abbot's death, and we've saved Jessica, so I was planning to set off on my travels.

<se_def>Angelo: But I can hardly leave you all under these circumstances.<page>Angelo: You'd never survive without me!
So I suppose I'll stay with you for a little while longer.
<se_low>Yangus: I wonder where the 'eck Jessica coulda got to?
<se_low>Yangus: You don't think she got kidnapped, do ya!?
<se_def>Angelo: Maybe she went home to Alexandria.
<se_def>Angelo: Perhaps she thought it would be too hard to say goodbye, so she left without saying anything at all...
<se_def>Angelo: No, that doesn't sound like the Jessica I know.
<se_low>Yangus: I blame Rhapthorne for them boss trolls nearly eatin' the Chancellor's family, y'know.

<se_low>Yangus: I don't mean 'e ordered them or nuffin'.
Well, I don't think so anyway!

<se_low>Yangus: Nah, just that Rhapthorne's makin' all the monsters go a bit crazy, like.
Them trolls included.
<se_low>Yangus: It feels a bit quiet 'ere wivout the bazaar, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: I dunno why they don't just 'ave it goin' all year. Like a tourist attraction type o' thing. Wot'd be wrong wiv that, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: Wot wiv the Prince always avoidin' that 'nitiation, an' the Chancellor nearly gettin' eaten, Argonia's 'ad its fair share o' trouble, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: I bet the Argonians'd never dream o' the Chancellor gettin' gobbled up by monsters in 'is own 'ouse, eh!?

<se_high>Jessica: Everything looks so normal on the surface.
The castle, the town, all of it. But dangerous things are happening behind the scenes.

<se_high>Jessica: It isn't just here. It's everywhere.
The only way to save the world from destruction is by defeating Rhapthorne.
<se_high>Jessica: The longer we take to beat Rhapthorne, the more the danger grows.
<se_high>Jessica: Now that the bazaar is over, it seems like ages since our ‘adventures’ with Prince Charmles.
<se_high>Jessica: I know it really hasn't been that long, but it certainly feels that way.

<se_high>Jessica: You know what I think?
The Chancellor is hiding somewhere because he's sick and tired of his job.
<se_high>Jessica: Sound familiar? It's just like our own Prince Charmless! Maybe it's a grand Argonian tradition, running away from your problems like that.
<se_high>Jessica: Wait! Isn't the Chancellor of Argonia still being held captive by some monsters!?

<se_high>Jessica: Why didn't we go and save him earlier!?
I feel kind of bad.
Let's get him out of there!

<se_def>Angelo: So it's thanks to us that the Chancellor's safe again! He's the brains of Argonia, you know!<page>Angelo: What would've become of the kingdom if his treasured grey matter had been scoffed by trolls!?
<se_def>Angelo: I've a good mind to complain that we haven't received some kind of official thanks, but maybe that'd be pushing our luck.
<se_def>Angelo: It doesn't look like anyone in Argonia knows about the Lord of Darkness yet.
<se_def>Angelo: No doubt there'd be a huge panic if people found out.
<se_def>Angelo: Defeating Rhapthorne is our top priority.

<se_def>Angelo: Never mind about the Argonian Chancellor now.
We can always help him out if we see him along the way.

<se_def>Angelo: There's no point going after the Chancellor now.
The whole family are probably already inside a boss troll's belly!
<se_low>Yangus: I'm always surprised at 'ow big Argonia is.
<se_low>Yangus: Huh! Orb-'untin' 'ere ain't gonna be no fun.
<se_high>Jessica: I don't recall any of the heirs to the great sages living in Argonia.
<se_high>Jessica: So I don't think we'll find an orb around here. But if you insist...
<se_def>Angelo: Once we've collected all the orbs, it'll be time to fight Rhapthorne.
<se_def>Angelo: Maybe we should get whatever we might need in battle while we're looking for them?
<se_high>Red: Seems like that mirror's only started glowin' pretty recently. S'pose it's summat to do wiv Rhapthorne, eh?
<se_high>Red: Wiv all the people around before, maybe it just didn't cross anyone's mind there might be somefin' brewin'. They prob'ly thought that red sky was just a nice sunset, eh?
<se_high>Red: Blimey, I wouldn't wanna be no castle guard, that's for sure. Not that all that business 'as got anyfin' to do wiv a commoner like me, mind.
<se_high>Red: ...Although, that means the old Chancellor's gaff's just sittin' there empty, does it? No one guardin' it or nuffin', eh? Hmmm...int'restin'...
<se_high>Red: Wot d'you reckon then, eh? Wot's the bettin' the next time we lay eyes on the Chancellor and 'is wife and wotnot, we'll be starin' at a bag o' bones?
<se_low>Morrie: Allora, the mirror, it still leads to the boss troll's place, ay? Even now, after we have defeated them already.
<se_low>Morrie: Then we have the perfetto place to practise the combattente. Just we must take a care we are not <endash> How do you say? <endash> ‘stewing their juices’, ay?

<se_low>Morrie: Argonia! Allora, what we are waiting for, ay?
We grab our purses by the strings and punch
the bazaar!
<se_low>Morrie: Che? The bazaar is finito already? Because of the Rhapthorne? Grrr, that...that...MOSTRO GRASSO!
<se_low>Morrie: Here, they are more worrying about the famiglia reale than the danger from the Rhapthorne, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Si, these boss trolls are tough as the old booties, but if we are turning tails, we cannot save the Chancellor and his famiglia, ay?
<se_high>Red: Wiv all the people around before, maybe it just didn't cross anyone's mind there might be somefin' brewin'. They prob'ly thought that red sky was just a nice sunset, eh?

<se_low>Morrie: Argonia! Allora, what we are waiting for, ay?
We grab our purses by the strings and punch
the bazaar!
<se_low>Morrie: Che? The bazaar is finito already? Because of the Rhapthorne? Grrr, that...that...MOSTRO GRASSO!
